    com.shopgun.android.sdk.database.ItemSQLiteHelper
    No longer maintained Class for handling the ShoppinglistItem SQLite table.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists.ListArrayListener
    No longer maintained
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists.ListManager
    No longer maintained This class provides methods, for easily handling of Shoppinglists, ShoppinglistItems, and Shares, without having to worry about keeping a sane, and synchronizing state with both the database and, the ShopGun API.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.database.ListSQLiteHelper
    No longer maintained Class for handling the Shoppinglist SQLite table.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.database.SgnDatabase
    no longer maintained A middle layer for performing certain transformations on the DB data, prior to returning it to the caller.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.database.SgnDataSource
    No longer maintained
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.database.SgnOpenHelper
    No longer maintained The SgnOpenHelper is a class for doing easy/clean database instantiation, and migration. SgnOpenHelper calls static methods to sub-classes (each subclass essentially being a table) to do creation and upgrades. This way any sub-class can be instantiated and queried for data without having the trouble of database creation and upgrades.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.model.Share
    shopping list no longer maintained
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.database.ShareSQLiteHelper
    No longer maintained Class for handling the Share SQLite table.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.model.Shoppinglist
    No longer maintained This class is a representation of the ShopGun API v2 shopppinglist.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.bus.ShoppinglistEvent
    No longer maintained
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.model.ShoppinglistItem
    No longer maintained
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists.SyncDebugger
    No longer maintained
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists.SyncInterval
    No longer maintained Supported synchronization intervals for SyncManager and is one of:
    • SLOW
    • MEDIUM
    • FAST
    • PAUSED
    Please only use SyncInterval.FAST when needed, e.g.: when the user is actively interacting with a Shoppinglist or it's ShoppinglistItem's.
    com.shopgun.android.sdk.shoppinglists.SyncManager
    No longer maintained The SyncManager class performs asynchronous synchronization with the ShopGun API, to propagate all Shoppinglist and ShoppinglistItem changes that a user may have done in the database.

    Notifications about Shoppinglist and ShoppinglistItem changes, are relayed through the subscriber system in the ListManager.

    There are four types of synchronization that will be performed:

    • Local changes - Sending local changes to the API has precedence over the other types of synchronization.
    • Shoppinglist.getModified() - This is the default action, this will be performed if no other type of synchronization is chosen. This in practice means that this will be performed on almost every iteration. If there is any changes in the modified, both the Shoppinglist and it's ShoppinglistItems will be synchronized.
    • Shoppinglist - Shoppinglists will be performed on every 3rd iteration the SyncManager does. As there are less chance of adding, and removing Shoppinglists than that of having a change to an existing Shoppinglist (which will be handled by the synchronization option above.
    • Full sync loop - The full sync loop is performed on every 10th iteration, and ensures that the state is completely up to date. The local state can become decoupled from the server state in certain situations, where we are not able to determine and fix the situation in any other way, e.g.: If two devices makes a change to a list at the exact same second, and both devices therefore has a valid/correct modified.

    When LifecycleManager calls destroy, all local pending changes are pushed to the API if possible to ensure a correct state on the server (and other devices).
